U.S PERIOD Steels Clairton Coke Works plant PERIOD

By  Pitt News Editorial Board  June  

Smog surrounded U.S PERIOD Steels Clairton Coke Works plant on Monday morning PERIOD The electrical fire served as a bleak reminder of the lingering air pollution in Pittsburgh as the City received an F grade for air quality in May PERIOD This is the second fire at the plant in the last six months  the first on Dec PERIOD  resulted in  exceedances of environmental standards PERIOD

Pittsburgh residents hoped that the plant and the City would work to form a solution to recurring contamination following the December fire though few improvements have been made PERIOD Solving the pollution problem seems to be a taboo topic amongst politicians  some argue that more regulations would cut jobs while ignoring parents who fear for the health of their children PERIOD But we place trust in these politicians to protect us and their refusal to acknowledge the health and environmental violations is doing the opposite PERIOD They need to step up and find a solution that treats all constituents fairly PERIOD

While there is no evidence thus far that the fire on Monday caused pollution levels to exceed legal limits the fire did damage the plants pollution control system PERIOD The Allegheny County Health Department confirmed that there is no backup to the pollution control system which could pose a problem with not only pollution detection now but sometime in the future PERIOD

And it isnt as if the plant simply slipped up out of the blue either PERIOD Since the Christmas Eve fire the plant has violated sulfur dioxide regulations  times PERIOD Such violations have led to issued warnings advising certain Pittsburgh area residents with respiratory or heart conditions to limit outdoor activity PERIOD This advisory extended to all children and the elderly as well PERIOD A study conducted by doctors from the Duquesne University School of Pharmacy discovered increased asthma severity among children with asthma who live near the plant following the December fire PERIOD

But despite all of the health risks politicians are hesitating to take a stance on the plants pollution crisis PERIOD Pennsylvania Lieutenant Governor John Fetterman has defended the U.S PERIOD Steel plant in the past saying that they have done the best anyone could possibly expect after the December fire PERIOD

Environmental groups including the Clean Air Council have filed for lawsuit under the Clean Air Act and also demanded that the plant be put in hot idle while the repairs were being made in December PERIOD Fetterman refused saying that plant engineers told him halting production would result in worker layoffs harming the local economy PERIOD

Politicians who do have the power to make direct change like Governor Tom Wolf have made no comment on the situation regarding the Coke Works plant PERIOD But its time for all Pennsylvania politicians to have an open and frank discussion about addressing the plants pollution PERIOD

While concerns about the economy are valid protecting the constituents is the most important job of a politician PERIOD The worsening symptoms in asthma sufferers rampant air pollution and recurring accidents within the coke plant indicate that constituents are not being adequately protected PERIOD The public shouldnt have to rally to demand air fit to breathe PERIOD
